result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew J Nickelsen

records.addlTxt: Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

TOTAL BOND COVERS ALL FILES 22CF409 & 22CF405
Bond to be co-signed by either Matthew Nickelsen Sr. or Ann Marie Heller

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH OFFICER B.M. OR RESIDENCE, OFFICER B.S. OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Not guilty plea by reason of mental disease/defect entered and trial reserved.

Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over.

2:30pm Court in session

Defendant Matthew Nickelsen present in court, in custody via video with attorney Mackenzie Renner. ADA Vivien TenHaken appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

Competency report received & reviewed. Defense is stipulating that Deft is competent to proceed. 
Further record by Atty Renner
Court has colloquy with Deft, Deft believes he is competent to proceed. 

State does not object to the Court relying on the report.

Court makes record & finds Deft is competent to proceed.

Defense is prepared to waive preliminary hearing today. 

NGI Plea entered, Court orders NGI exam

Parties are stipulating to modifying bond
Deft's parents are both present in court

Court will modify bond to a surety bond, all same prior conditions remain
Matthew Nickelsen
Ann Marie Heller

11/23 @ 1:15pm
Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Competency Evaluation Extension Letter

8/16/22 Court's response: Extension granted. KED

-Parties emailed for new date (bb)
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew J Nickelsen in court, in custody by video. Attorney Renner and Attorney Ryan for defendant. Court finds there is a reason to doubt defendant's competency to proceed and ORDERS A COMPETENCY EXAMINATION - Sec. 971.14. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Cash bond filed. Defendant refused to sign.

BOND TO COVER 22GF782 & 22CF405

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH OFFICER B.M. OR RESIDENCE, OFFICER B.S. OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

22-3513

Defendant Matthew J Nickelsen not in court. Samuel Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not cooperating in custody. New total bond set. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
